item.title: This Nifty 'Notes' App Is Available to Install as a Snap Package - OMG! Ubuntu!
item.description:
This Nifty 'Notes' App Is Available to Install as a Snap Package - OMG! Ubuntu!

Remember that nifty OS X inspired Notes app we wrote about a few months back? Whether you do or you don't, if you're running Ubuntu 16.04 LTS it's now super easy to install. Notes is now available as a Snap, the new Ubuntu package format installed by default in the latest long-term support release.

item.title: The GNOME Foundation welcomes ARM device donations
item.description:
The GNOME Foundation welcomes ARM device donations

ORINDA, CA. Recently, the GNOME Foundation sent out a request seeking donations of ARM build server hardware so that the GNOME project could improve the support and quality of the GNOME desktop on ARM devices.

item.title: Power tools: Sorting through the crowded specialized database toolbox
item.description:
Power tools: Sorting through the crowded specialized database toolbox

View all... When you think of game development, the first thing that comes to mind probably isn't a database. But in the world of Jamaa, the setting for WildWorks' massively multiplayer online kids' game , a database keeps millions of cartoon animal characters frolicking and the cartoon trees from crashing down.

item.title: Ubuntu 16.10's YY Codename Revealed - Phoronix
item.description:
Ubuntu 16.10's YY Codename Revealed - Phoronix

Phoronix is the leading technology website for Linux hardware reviews, open-source news, Linux benchmarks, open-source benchmarks, and computer hardware tests.

item.title: Firefox 46 Released, Finally Brings GTK3 Integration - OMG! Ubuntu!
item.description:
Firefox 46 Released, Finally Brings GTK3 Integration - OMG! Ubuntu!

A new version of the Mozilla Firefox web browser is available to download. Firefox 46.0 comes (as always) with a modest set of improvements, including GTK3 integration for the Linux desktop builds. This - long promised - change will improve the way Firefox looks and feels on modern Linux desktops.

item.title: Wayland 1.11 Planned For Release At The End Of May - Phoronix
item.description:
Wayland 1.11 Planned For Release At The End Of May - Phoronix

Bryce Harrington has laid out plans for shipping the next major version of Wayland (v1.11) around the end of May and of course joined by Weston 1.11. Bryce, employed by Samsung's Open-Source Group, has been serving as the Wayland release manager for a while now.

item.title: Other Linux Distributions Begin Analyzing Clear Linux's Performance Optimizations - Phoronix
item.description:
Other Linux Distributions Begin Analyzing Clear Linux's Performance Optimizations - Phoronix

Fedora developers appear to be among those analyzing Intel's Clear Linux distribution for the performance optimizations made. In case you haven't been following our many original performance tests in the past months, Intel's Clear Linux is surprisingly fast. Clear Linux just isn't fast for server/workstation/enterprise workloads but even for Intel graphics performance and other general workloads.

item.title: Patches For A New /dev/random Linux Random Number Generator Revised - Phoronix
item.description:
Patches For A New /dev/random Linux Random Number Generator Revised - Phoronix

Stephan Mueller has published his second version of the in-development patches of the Linux Random Number Generator (LRNG) that seeks to provide a new, drop-in replacement for Linux's /dev/random implementation. Mueller describes of his work in V2 form, "The following patch set provides a different approach to /dev/random which I call Linux Random Number Generator (LRNG) to collect entropy within the Linux kernel.

item.title: Vivaldi 1.1 Web Browser Released - Phoronix
item.description:
Vivaldi 1.1 Web Browser Released - Phoronix

If you aren't excited by today's Firefox 46 release with GTK3 support but happen to be a fan of the up-and-coming, multi-platform Vivaldi web-browser, there is a new release on that front too. The Opera-inspired Vivaldi web-browser is up to its v1.1 milestone, less than one month after the Vivaldi 1.0 debut.
